text: When trying to use code to see if the page being viewed is a blog post or the listing, would the `is_listing_view: true,` variable be the right one to target
essentially, im adding things to a global header but only if someone is viewing an actual post and not so much the main blog listing
yes <@U2H3TT8F2> - check this out if you need Documentation confirmation :wink: (<http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/blog-content-markup#if-is-listing-view-statement>)
You could probably also use any of the other {{content.<parameter>}} variables that are "post-specific" and evaluate if it's empty (or not set, whatever the right expression test is)

fair warning is_listing_view caused issues for me when I cloned the standard blog content module in design manager v2. I had reported the issue. don’t know if they fixed it (it blocked saving  your module) in my case I worked around it somehow, forgot how.
How does everyone handle breadcrumbs on the blog? Do you do breadcrumbs just as `blog > Blog title` or do you do `blog > first blog tag > blog title`? I'm trying to find a good breadcrumb layout.

usually the first one

Since many posts have multiple tags it seems like a bad idea to throw in just the first tag. I can’t speak to if that’s best SEO practice though
If I use them It is usually blog > title
